subsection_content: Colitis can cause many complications that affect quality of life, increase morbidity and mortality, and are common in patients with ulcerative colitis and Crohn's disease. Complications such as: colon stricture, intestinal fistula, colorectal abscess, intestinal perforation or toxic megacolon. Long-term ulcerative colitis also increases the risk of developing bowel cancer, increasing mortality. In addition, extra-gastrointestinal complications may occur such as: osteoporosis, hypercoagulability, anemia, gallstones, aphthous ulcers, primary sclerosing cholangitis, arthritis...

viem dai trang.json. Complications of colitis
Colitis can cause many complications that affect quality of life, increase morbidity and mortality, and are common in patients with ulcerative colitis and Crohn's disease. Complications such as: colon stricture, intestinal fistula, colorectal abscess, intestinal perforation or toxic megacolon. Long-term ulcerative colitis also increases the risk of developing bowel cancer, increasing mortality. In addition, extra-gastrointestinal complications may occur such as: osteoporosis, hypercoagulability, anemia, gallstones, aphthous ulcers, primary sclerosing cholangitis, arthritis...
